cyclone.name: BERYL
cyclone.current_location: about 1140 mi ESE of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating toward the west-northwest, aiming for the Lesser Antilles and then into the eastern Caribbean while weakening
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of the central Lesser Antilles (Dominica–Martinique area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lesser Antilles from Guadeloupe southward to St. Lucia, with eastern Caribbean islands in the path thereafter
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible as the weakening system passes south of Puerto Rico.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor coastal run-up possible on south-facing beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of showers may bring 1–3 inches of rain, locally higher in mountains, Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased surf and rip currents along the south and southeast coasts beginning late Sunday.
